title: Vinyl Goddess from Mars
content:
How many of you played [url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/vinyl-goddess-from-mars]Vinyl Goddess from Mars[/url]. It started as Jill of the Jungle II, but that didn't happen.
Anyway I've updated my site with a [url=http://www.student.tue.nl/p/f.a.m.smeijers/sfp/games/vinyl.htm]Vinyl Goddess from Mars page[/url] with an extractor that I've quickly put together.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Vinyl Goddess from Mars
content:
I remember that. I had the demo diskette, which unfortunately became corrupted.

Twas kinda fun, might play it again. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Vinyl Goddess from Mars
content:
No, that's not me.
BTW Frank Krul wrote a review about Radix on Mobygames called [url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/radix-beyond-the-void/reviews/reviewerId,15699/]By the Company that ripped off their developers...[/url].Groeten van Frenkel

title: Re: Vinyl Goddess from Mars
content:
Wow, how'd you figure out the file format? I've been working on this one for a while, but I must've got the format wrong since half the files are missing filenames with my extractor.

BTW - it looks like you forgot to include "filename.txt" in the .zip.

title: Re: Vinyl Goddess from Mars
content: yes, i have the full version of this game downloaded it from an abandonware site it's also a shame you can't buy it anymore so the only way to get it is to download illegallyRorie
